definition: to prick/to run or stick (a needle etc) into/jug (a classifier for liquids such as beer)
to tie/to bind/classifier for flowers, banknotes etc: bundle/Taiwan pr. [zha2]
to dye/to catch (a disease)/to acquire (bad habits etc)/to contaminate/to add color washes to a painting

sentences.english: My new purchase yesterday, tie dye T-shirt.
sentences.chinese: 昨天逛街的收获，扎染T恤。

sentences.english: I bought a great tie-dyed silk scarf .
sentences.chinese: 我买了条非常好的扎染丝巾。

sentences.english: New surface effects and treatments have emerged from the tie-dye trend.
sentences.chinese: 新表面效果与处理从扎染潮流中脱颖而出。

sentences.english: He wore a T-shirt that had been tie -dyed in bright colours.
sentences.chinese: 他身穿一件颜色鲜艳的扎染的T恤。

sentences.english: There she'd stand in her father's old T-shirt, tie-dyed with big blue spots and streaks.
sentences.chinese: 她身穿她爸爸的旧T恤，上面扎染上蓝色的点和线条。

sentences.english: Most dreamers have at least one tie-dye T-shirt in their wardrobe.
sentences.chinese: 大多数空想家的衣橱里都有扎染风情的T恤衫。

definition: batik (color printing on cloth using wax)
papercutting (Chinese folk art)/to make paper cutouts
Suzhou embroidery, one of the four major traditional styles of Chinese embroidery (the other three being 湘繡|湘绣[Xiang1 xiu4], 粵繡|粤绣[Yue4 xiu4] and 蜀繡|蜀绣[Shu3 xiu4])
woven palm fiber (used in handicraft)/coir/woven coconut fiber
